comments.raw_text:
We don't have the keys to Windows Update, but we do have a way to message hundreds of millions of Firefox users about driver updates required for hardware acceleration. We currently surface technical details about hardware acceleration and driver versions on about:support but for those people who have blocklisted drivers it would be nice to let them know they can upgrade to get our Awesome Firefox Experience. 

I propose we surface the relevant about:support information, written up in a more user-friendly manner, on the Firefox Start page with a link to docs that tell people how to get updates for the most common of the blocklisted drivers.

This could happen in a "general information" or "tips and tricks" section of Firefox Start or it could just be a special area for just those users with blocklisted drivers.

If this is not possible for Firefox 4 (I can completely understand that) then I think we should at least look into it for a follow-up release.  

(See also bug 627301)

I was about to file a bug on something similar, after reading bug 623317.
	
Adding to the start page sounds ideal; but since it's not going to make Fx4 (plus not everyone uses about:home), how about...

Short term:

- Add a link to an "Update your drivers" knowledgebase article to the snippets that are fed to about:home. Won't be as good as a more obvious banner/logic that only shows it to people whose driver is blacklisted, but it would be a start.
- Adding a "Make sure you have the _latest driver_" next to the "Firefox now offers hardware acceleration" part of the marketing feature page
- Adding something similar to the relnote


Longer term:

- Adding to about:home using more advanced logic tied into the about:support info, plus a more obvious notification than just using snippets
- Providing feedback in the Fx advanced options panel next to "enable hardware acceleration if available"; with status and/or a link to an 'update drivers' KB page if their driver has been blocklisted due to age
- Adding a banner/note to the plugin check page

Thanks Benoit; and sorry Aza if this hijacks your bug somewhat.

One of my concerns at the moment is that reviewers/curious users of other browsers are going to try Fx4, run a web demo/use for browsing in general and then judge un-accelerated performance without even knowing Firefox isn't using layers/D2D/OGL. This will be compounded by the fact that the current prefs UI ("use h/w accel if available") doesn't give any indication as to actual status - and that most people won't know about about:support. 

It may also be worth adding to the relnote, that updating old drivers does not lift the blocklist immediately, per bug 631118.

comments.text:
Created attachment 517900
Mozilla & You newsletter screen grab of featured plugin check content

More short term options:
We can also add to our "Mozilla & You" newsletter, with a database of mainstream users north of 450,000 subscribers by Fx 4 release. The Plugin Check currently has very successful click throughs. We can replace that content with graphics for a while. See the image for a snapshot of the existing plugin check content in the newsletter. Just let us know if you want to move ahead and we'll revise the content for March.  Note - this is broadly an English speaking audience. 

Post Fx 4 launch we can also do reminders via our twitter followers (390k) and Facebook fans (3.7M). Those channels have also performed well for us in the past re: the plugin check.

Long term:
We should have a longer conversation, if we can / want to use the about:home for things like this. My gut says yes, if we're able to do any detection and provide easy how-to next steps.
